description_html: This gallery contains images of the personalities of people famous for their work in technology.
story_html:
Steve and Susan are both famous for their work in Silicon Valley. Steve's image shows the close-mindedness and determination typical of a boss, while Susan's image shows the openness typical of a worker.

To see more images of bosses and workers, follow this site on social media or subscribe to the Artsy Visions Monthly Newsletter!

image_list.title: Steve Jobs
image_list.subtitle_html: Co-founder and CEO of
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Steve Jobs' spiritual portrait shows he is outgoing, extremely determined and decisive, mostly cold but capable of warmth, and has a tendency to think out of the box.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Steve's dominant personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in Steve's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being/tendency to be logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_dom_very_slight_preference: It's important to note this preference/tendency is very slight, and Steve can be quite _____ in some situations/when the situation calls for it.
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Steve's auxiliary personality trait, iNtuition: idealism and hope for the future; openness to new ideas; very slight/moderate/strong preference for ideas over facts.

The Blue in Steve's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing/tendency to see the world more in terms of ideas than of facts; need for intellectual stimulation.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux_very_slight_preference: It's important to note this preference is very slight, and Steve can be quite _____ in some situations/when the situation calls for it.
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.

image_list.title: Susan Fowler
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Susan Fowler's spiritual portrait shows she is reticent, idealistic, and motivated by her compassion for others.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in Susan's spiritual portrait represents her dominant personality trait, her very slight preference for being more personal than impersonal.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  She demonstrated this trait when she decided to call out Uber for abusing their workers, even though she no longer worked there, showing that she cares for people other than herself.  It's important to note this tendency is very slight, and Susan can be quite cold and logical when she needs to be.
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Susan's auxiliary personality trait, her preference for learning principles and ideas rather than just facts.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  She demonstrated this trait by pursuing degrees in both Philosophy and Physics while at the University of Pennsylvania.
